Types

HeaderField = tuple[key, val: string]
A header field. See RFC 9110 section 6.3 for details.   Source   Edit 
JsonPostable = concept x
    ## The concept of HTTP client.
    ## This abstraction is useful for various HTTP client implementations.
    ## 
    ## This library also provides `HttpClient` implementation as a default.
    x.postJson(Uri, JsonNode, openArray[HeaderField]) is JsonResponse
    x.postMultipart(Uri, MultipartData, openArray[HeaderField]) is
        JsonResponse
  Source   Edit 
JsonResponse = tuple[code: HttpCode, headers: seq[HeaderField], body: JsonNode]
A response with JSON body.   Source   Edit 
MisskeyClient[T] = ref object
  httpClient: T
  host: Uri
  accessToken: string
A client for Misskey API. This is a thin wrapper of JsonPostable and provides some useful methods.   Source   Edit

Procs

func hasAccessToken[T](client: MisskeyClient[T]): bool
Check if the client has an access token. If the client has an access token, this returns true. Otherwise, this returns false.
Note:This does not check if the access token is valid.

Example:

let client = newMisskeyClient("https://misskey.example.com")
assert not client.hasAccessToken()

client.putAccessToken("dummyAccessToken")
assert client.hasAccessToken()
  Source   Edit

proc putAccessToken[T](client: MisskeyClient[T]; accessToken: sink string) {.
    ...raises: [ValueError].}
Put an access token to the client. If the access token is empty, this raises ValueError.   Source   Edit

Remove the access token from the client.   Source   Edit

template newMisskeyClient(host: Uri | string): MisskeyClient[HttpClient]
Create a new MisskeyClient. This uses std/httpclient as a default HTTP client.   Source   Edit
